teal.sim.properties

Interface HasAcceleration

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HasVelocity

    public interface HasAcceleration
extends HasVelocity
    WorldObjects that have an acceleration should implement this interface. We assume a WorldObject that implements this interface will store their acceleration in vector format, where the vector is composed of x, y, and z double coordinates. By implementing this interface, a WorldObject allows read/write access to their current acceleration. They also provide the means to calculate what their acceleration will be given any position, velocity, and time. Vector3d objects can be used to set and retrieve current acceleration. Additionally, double parameters can be passed and returned to avoid the overhead of Vector3d object creation.
